concept.title: Data Linking
concept.shortdesc: The indexing, cataloging, and graph relationships generates allow you to make connections, or links, among data items.

conbody.p: Data linking allows you to connect disparate data and data that might have been isolated in silos. For example, imagine you ingest a patient history from a family doctor, a scan of prescription information from a pharmacy, Medical Resonance Images (MRIs) from a hospital, and X-ray images from a medical laboratory. If data elements are tagged with appropriate metadata, you can link all this disparate data (for example, with a patient ID number) for use in various ways.
Graph-based data linking means that you can query and analyze a more complete picture of your data so that you can see, at scale and efficiently, relationships between objects in the system.
